intro: Glochidion balsahanense, commonly known as the Balsahanense glabrous vine, is a tropical plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruits are capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Glochidion balsahanense is often found in lowland forests and is adapted to humid, shaded environments.
